chargeHist.descr: Deliver Heroin within 1000 feet of park (<3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan B. BELTZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Defendant is to use only one doctor and one pharmacist for obtaining and filing prescriptions.

Defendant is to have no association with any known drug dealers or users.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan B. BELTZ

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The defendant has successfully completed the Earned Release Program as of 07-08-16.
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days that are converted from confinement time to extended supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Cover letter.

Transcript of sentencing hearing held on 10-16-15.
Copy of transcript of sentencing hearing mailed to Registrar at Dodge Correctional Instituiton.

Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  $10,000.00 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued by the Court. Plea Date set for 10-16-2015 at 10:00 a.m., Br. 1.  (Notice given to defendant.)
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Defendant failed to appear for plea date.   Bench warrant authorized.

Plea date is set for 07-10-15 at 2:00 p.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 07-10-15 at 2:00 p.m.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-17-15 at 2:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.
Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 04-28-15 at 3:00 p.m.  
Minutes.
RE:  Deliver Heroin within 1000 feet of park, on 12-11-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of deliver heroin within 1000 feet of a park.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-20-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
